executive_summary: Nephrologists are instrumental in addressing the rising rates of renal diseases in the US. Demographic trends have been responsible for this rise in recent years, since older adults have a higher incidence of developing a kidney condition and a sizeable portion of the US population is of advanced age. Rising health expenditure, federal initiatives and heightened insurance coverage have all facilitated access to comprehensive renal care.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Despite recent volatility, industry revenue expanding
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite recent volatility, though, industry-wide revenue has been expanding at a CAGR of 1.4% to an estimated $8.2 billion over the past five years, including expected growth of 0.6% in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: High rates of burnout and turnover deepening staffing shortages
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: High rates of burnout and turnover have deepened the staffing shortages that had been occurring in the nephrology field before the pandemic. Hiring challenges for nurses and physicians have pressured wage growth as practices and healthcare providers outside of the industry vie to attract and retain employees.

Leveraging technology – like telemedicine, electronic health record software and AI – is helping some practices address shortages through its potential to free up employee time while delivering cost savings.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Nephrologists will remain in high demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Current demand for nephrologists will only expand moving forward. A large portion of the population is of advanced age, many with complex medical needs, which will be the main factor driving growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Nephrologists will treat more Medicare patients
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Treating a higher share of Medicare patients will bring challenges, since Medicare pays less in reimbursements than private insurers do.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Tech advances will reshape nephrology landscape
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Nephrology providers will become more intertwined with tech advances and artificial intelligence. Emerging technology has the potential to strengthen how nephrologists operate, but its adoption will introduce obstacles as well.

industry_definition: Nephrologists are medical doctors specializing in the study, diagnosis and treatment of diseases of the kidneys. These physicians are also involved in

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Federal funding for Medicare and Medicaid
threats: Number of people with private health insurance

key_trends: Nephrologists have been central to meeting the expanding needs for kidney care. An aging population and growing rates of renal diseases have made these physicians more important.
Staffing challenges characterize the nephrology field. Shortages of nephrologists, nurses and nonclinical staff jeopardize care and threaten profit growth.

A framework of federal and state regulations oversees every aspect of a nephrology practice. Keeping compliant with regulations isn't optional, meaning practices failing to meet safety, quality and ethical standards are at risk of serious financial, legal and disciplinary consequences.
Federal funding directed toward patients indirectly benefits nephrologists. Financial assistance available for patients with kidney disease supports access to nephrology providers.
Nephrologists depend on reimbursements from private insurers more than any other revenue source. Commercial insurers pay higher prices to nephrologists for patient care than public insurers.

products_and_services.product_description: Nephrology is a complex specialty, with nephrologists responsible for everything from diagnosis to treatment and dialysis management. Because of this, nephrologists receive the bulk of their revenue through general care billings.
Nephrologists also oversee the care of patients undergoing kidney transplantation.
Fewer patients receive kidney transplants than those receiving routine care for a kidney condition, limiting revenue received from transplants despite its high cost.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Reimbursements from Private Insurers Makeup the Bulk of Revenue
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Commercial insurers are the single-largest payer of nephrologists. Medicare dictates what it reimburses for patient care, while private insurers must negotiate their rates. Since Medicare has more leverage to keep its share low, private insurers make up the difference, leading to higher payments to nephrology providers.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: PUBLIC INSURERS' PAYMENTS TO NEPHROLOGISTS ARE VOLATILE
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Reimbursements from Medicare are essential to the financial well-being of a nephrology provider, especially considering Medicare insures the nation's senior citizens and the prevalence of kidney conditions among this population.

basis_points.basis_description: Complex regulatory, financial and legal requirements create steep barriers.
Navigating a dynamic and evolving regulatory landscape is costly, time intensive and challenging for a new nephrology provider.
Consolidation occurring across the healthcare sector is trickling into the nephrology field.
While nephrology providers are experiencing higher rates of consolidation activity, the industry's landscape remains fragmented.
How much nephrologists receive in reimbursements is in the hands of insurance providers.
Payer-provider negotiations, quality metrics, provider networks and compliance standards tilt the scale toward insurers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are the single-largest expense for nephrology providers and chronic staffing shortages have pressured practices to raise wages.
Existing shortages were worsened by the COVID-19 pandemic, as many nurses and nonclinical employees left the industry entirely as a result of low pay or burnout.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patents and patent concentration
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry.
Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Patients that forgo treatment for kidney conditions risk developing more serious illnesses or life-threatening situations.
Many patients receiving treatment for a kidney condition require regular medical monitoring and follow-up visits, providing nephrologists with ongoing, steady patient volumes.
The COVID-19 pandemic introduced unprecedented financial, workforce and supply chain challenges into the nephrology field.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Nephrologists responsible for general kidney care
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Nephrology is a complex specialty, with nephrologists responsible for everything from diagnosis to treatment and dialysis management.
Nephrologists also oversee the care of patients undergoing kidney transplantation. Transplants are a complex operation combining the expertise of many healthcare professionals.
